persistence

Interface Persistence

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FilePersistence

    public interface Persistence
    Persistence is an interface representing a generic contract for persisting an Entity.
    Author:
    YingHao

        <T extends Entity> T create(T entity,
                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates an entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - - Entity to be persisted.
        type - - Type of the entity to be persisted.
        Returns:
        A managed entity representing the persisted version of the entity argument passed into this method.

        java.lang.Exception

      • search

        <T extends Entity> java.lang.Iterable<T> search(Predicate<T> predicate,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                              boolean loadBeforePredicate)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches through the given type and applying Predicate.test(Object) and returning matching entities.
        Parameters:
        predicate - - Predicate indicating which entities to be accepted or rejected. Can be null, of which the entire list belonging to the specified type is retrieved.
        type - - Type of entity to be searched.
        loadBeforePredicate - - Indicates if all entity references should be loaded during predicate evaluation or after predicate evaluation.
        Returns:
        An Iterable that represents the managed entities that matches the given predicate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCount

        <T extends Entity> long getCount(Predicate<T> predicate,
                               java.lang.Class<T> type,
                               boolean loadBeforePredicate)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches through the given type and applying Predicate.test(Object) and returning the number of matching entities.
        Parameters:
        predicate - - Predicate indicating which entities to be accepted or rejected. Can be null, of which the entire list belonging to the specified type is counted.
        type - - Type of entity to be searched.
        loadBeforePredicate - - Indicates if all entity references should be loaded during predicate evaluation or after predicate evaluation.
        Returns:
        long value indicating the number of entities that matches the predicate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • retrieveByID

        <T extends Entity> T retrieveByID(long id,
                                java.lang.Class<T> type)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves a given entity via its unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - - Unique identifier
        type - - Type of the entity to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A managed entity with the unique identifier or null if it does not exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
